title: KT-15846 'Change lambda expression return type' quick fix does nothing
body: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-15846

title: JVM_IR: use fresh source map when generating lambda body for inline.
body: Otherwise, file mappings in the source map would be accumulated, resulting in consistent shifting of line numbers (as shown at `smap.kt` test).

title: Don't assume default constructor in Java classes read from bytecode.  Fixes https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-37107
body: This change limits logic to assume presence of a default constructor to Java classes read from source, where these constructors are implicit.  When classes are read from bytecode or through reflection, default constructors are explicit, so if no constructors are available there really aren't any.

title: JVM_IR: fix accesses from crossinline lambdas in other packages
body: Not sure how many more attempts I'll need to finally get this right.

title: KT-37217 Replace UseExperimental with OptIn intention removes target prefixes for annotations
body: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-37217

title: JVM IR: Generate fewer CHECKCAST instructions
body: Plus some small codegen fixes. Generating redundant CHECKCAST instructions can end up confusing tools which look for specific bytecode patterns. That's what the `testNoCheckcastInClinit` is about.

title: KT-37260: Several ReplaceWith expressions in kotlinRefactoringUtil missing parameter
body: https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-37260

title: JVM_IR: reuse method nodes for $$forInline versions of suspend funs
body:
**Depends on #3056 (first commit).**

This should improve performance a bit, especially with nested hierarchies of anonymous objects/lambdas in suspend methods. Also, this fixes non-local returns from inline suspend functions, as currently they are remapped to `$$forInline` versions so the bytecode of the original is incorrect (this is only observable from Java or by tools like Proguard which complain about the nonexistent class `$$$$$NON_LOCAL_RETURN$$$$$`); the only alternative here is to worsen the performance even more by copying lambdas as well.

title: JVM, JVM IR: Do not generate annotations or generic signatures on bridge methods
body:
This seems to be more in line with what javac is doing, as javac does not produce generic signatures for bridge methods. Plus the current behavior of the JVM backend is to take the generic signature from the *bridge target* instead of the overridden method, which is clearly wrong.

For example, in
```kotlin
interface MS<T> : MutableSet<T>

abstract class AbstractStringStringMap : MutableMap<String, String> by HashMap<String, String>() {
    abstract override val keys: MS<String>
}
```
we produce a method
```java
public bridge final <()LMS<Ljava/lang/String;>;> method keySet(): java.util.Set
```
whose generic signature does not even match its descriptor.

title: KT-37080: (maven-plugin) config for force execution even without Kotlin sources
body:
In case if Kotlin needs to be added to the existing Java/Maven project there is a need to reconfigure `maven-compiler-plugin` to set the proper order of executions. In the end `kotlin-maven-plugin` will be executed first. This can be not an ideal case for projects that are using annotation processing quite heavily. For example project may contain multiple modules and `maven-compiler-plugin` is configured in the root POM to unify the setup once. But in case if configuration contained annotation processing it is recommended to let this be done by `kapt`. But `kapt` does not perform annotation processing for modules where there is only java source code. 

Detailed example:
```
- root-module
-- java-only-module
-- ... other modules
-- java-kotlin-module
```

> `root-module` contains `maven-compiler-plugin` configuration with annotation processors

> other modules are using this single config for build

After adding Kotlin to `java-kotlin-module` there is a need to reconfigure `maven-compiler-plugin`. But after this reconfiguration annotation processing will stop working in modules other than this one.

This is a limitation that can be solved by current PR. The idea is to allow force execution of `kapt` via a dedicated parameter - `forceExecutionWithoutKotlinSources`. The default is still `false` to be compatible.

title: KT-15262: Allow generate toString() to include properties with non-default getters
body: This resolves [KT-15262](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-15262), but also has the side effect of allowing properties with non-default getter (i.e delegated properties) to be included in the wizard when generating `toString()`, `equals()` and `hashCode()`. Happy to refine this further if this isn't ideal.

title: [JVM IR] Improve debugging of inline $default methods
body:
Improves the stepping behaviour around inline methods with default
arguments. In particular, we now accurately step through the
evaluation of default arguments, but do _not_ spuriously show the exit
from the $default handler.

title: Use ModuleOrderEntry instead of ModuleOrderEntryImpl
body:
`isProductionOnTestDependency` function was moved from implementation to
interface. The fix is important for the new IJ project model.

The change has been made on 23 may 2019 (IJ 2019.2 release I guess). (24d4de10f4da2e6391e16fbd37e8d5f303af044a IJ project)
